title: Components of the Linear Equation (Slope-Intercept Form)
description: Identify and define the parameters m (slope) and b (y-intercept) in the equation y = mx + b.
example_easy_question: In the equation y = 3x - 2, what is the value of the slope?
example_medium_question: Identify the y-intercept in the function f(x) = 5 - 2x.
example_hard_question: If a line has a slope of 0 and passes through y=4, write its equation.

title: Calculating Slope from Two Points
description: Apply the slope formula m = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1) given two coordinate points.
example_medium_question: Find the slope of the line passing through (-2, 5) and (1, -1).
example_hard_question: The slope between (k, 3) and (2, 5) is 1. Find k.

title: Constructing the Linear Equation
description: Determine the full equation y = mx + b given different inputs (slope and point, or two points).
example_easy_question: Write the equation of a line with slope 2 and y-intercept 3.
example_medium_question: Find the linear equation that passes through (0, 4) with a slope of -1.
example_hard_question: Determine the equation of the line passing through (-3, 2) and (5, -2).

title: Graphing Linear Functions
description: Represent a linear equation on the coordinate plane using slope and intercept or tables.
example_hard_question: Sketch the graph of 2x + 3y = 6 by finding the intercepts.

title: Interpreting Linear Models in Context
description: Interpret the meaning of slope (rate of change) and intercept (initial value) in real-world scenarios.
example_easy_question: A taxi charges $2 start + $1/km. What does the $2 represent?
example_medium_question: In the model C(t) = 50t + 100 representing cost over time, interpret the coefficient 50.
example_hard_question: Compare the rates of change of two different cell phone plans given their equations and determine which is cheaper at x=100.
